alert.note: Alert for Marathon; Portage; Waupaca (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:10PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Portage, southeastern Marathon and northwestern Waupaca Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 809 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms from near Milladore to Dancy and Knowlton to near Stevens Point to Polonia. The thunderstorms were moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail along with torrential rainfall with rainfall rates over an inch per hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bevent. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
